channel.title: Rugby Walks
channel.description: A short series of guided walks around this historic town in the heart of England - the home of Rugby Football and the famous Rugby School the setting for the classic 19th century novel Tom Brown's School Days.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Walks in historic Rugby Town
channel.itunes:summary: A short series of guided walks around this historic town in the heart of England - the home of Rugby Football and the famous Rugby School, the setting for the classic 19th century novel Tom Brown's School Days.
channel.itunes:author: Jane Markham

item.title: The Blue Plaque Tour
item.description: This short guided walk takes in some of Rugby's 'Blue Plaques' commemorating the town's famous buildings, people and events from the poet Rupert Brook to the father of the jet engine Sir Frank Whittle. Extra copies of this audio are available already loaded onto mp3 players from the town's visitor centre.
item.author: jane@podcats.co.uk
item.itunes:subtitle: The Blue Plaque Tour - a guided walk around Rugby town
item.itunes:summary: This short guided walk takes in some of Rugby's 'Blue Plaques' commemorating the town's famous buildings, people and events from the poet Rupert Brook to the father of the jet engine Sir Frank Whittle. Extra copies of this audio are available already loaded onto mp3 players from the town's visitor centre.
item.itunes:author: Jane Markham
item.itunes:keywords: Blue Plaque, Rupert Brook, Frank Whittle, jet engine,

item.title: The Rugby Pathway of Fame Part Two
item.description: The second part of this two part audio tour following the trail of rugby balls set in the pavements of Rugby town. Today we start at number 19 - on Church Street outside St Andrews Church. Former England fly half Les Cusworth leads the way with the help of Blue Badge guide Roger Bailey
item.author: jane@podcats.co.uk
item.itunes:subtitle: Part two of an audio tour of Rugby Town following the trail of bronze rugby balls with former England rugby star Les Cusworth
item.itunes:summary: The second part of this two part audio tour following the trail of rugby balls set in the pavements of Rugby town. Today we start at number 19 - on Church Street outside St Andrews Church. Former England fly half Les Cusworth leads the way with the help of Blue Badge guide Roger Bailey
item.itunes:author: Jane Markham
item.itunes:keywords: rugby, Les Cusworth,audio tour,rugby player,rugby players,history, rugby history,

item.title: The Rugby Pathway of Fame
item.description: The Rugby Pathway of Fame follows fifty brass rugby footballs set in the pavements of this historic town. Former England Rugby star Les Cusworth and Blue Badge Guide Roger Bailey are our guides on part one of this fascinating walk
item.itunes:subtitle: Walk the Rugby Pathway of Fame with Rugby star Les Cusworth
item.itunes:summary: The Rugby Pathway of Fame follows fifty brass rugby footballs set in the pavements of this historic town. Former England Rugby star Les Cusworth and Blue Badge Guide Roger Bailey are our guides on part one of this fascinating walk
item.itunes:author: Jane Markham
